name: Dates
reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'A house without dates is a house without food.'
benefits: Dates are rich in fiber, antioxidants, and essential vitamins like potassium and magnesium. They help with digestion and provide long-lasting energy.

name: Honey
reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Honey is a cure for every disease.'
benefits: Honey has antibacterial and anti-inflammatory properties, and it's known for its ability to boost the immune system and soothe sore throats.

name: Olives
reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Eat olive oil and use it on your hair and skin, for it is a blessed tree.'
benefits: Olives are rich in healthy fats, antioxidants, and vitamins, which help reduce inflammation, improve heart health, and nourish skin.

name: Figs
reference: The Quran mentions: 'By the fig and the olive.' (Quran 95:1)
benefits: Figs are a rich source of fiber, antioxidants, and minerals like calcium and magnesium. They promote digestive health and are good for heart health.

name: Pomegranate
reference: The Quran mentions: 'In them [Gardens] will be fruits, and dates and pomegranates.' (Quran 55:68)
benefits: Pomegranates are rich in antioxidants, vitamins, and minerals, particularly Vitamin C and potassium. They are known for their anti-inflammatory and heart-protective properties.

name: Barley
reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Barley is a healing food.'
benefits: Barley is a whole grain rich in fiber, vitamins, and minerals like magnesium. It supports heart health, helps with weight loss, and regulates blood sugar levels.

name: Lamb
reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'The best meat is the meat of lamb.'
benefits: Lamb is a rich source of high-quality protein, essential vitamins like B12, and minerals like iron and zinc. It's good for muscle growth, bone health, and immunity.

name: Chicken
reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Eat chicken for it is beneficial.'
benefits: Chicken is a great source of lean protein, essential amino acids, and B vitamins. It's low in fat and helps maintain muscle mass, skin health, and metabolism.

name: Almonds
reference: Mentioned in Islamic tradition as a source of sustenance and strength.
benefits: Almonds are rich in healthy fats, vitamin E, magnesium, and protein. They support heart health, improve brain function, and help regulate blood sugar.

name: Mint
reference: Used widely in prophetic medicine and traditional Islamic remedies for its cooling and calming properties.
benefits: Mint aids in digestion, freshens breath, and has soothing effects on the stomach and nerves.

name: Olive Oil
reference: The Prophet (ﷺ) said: 'Eat olive oil and anoint yourselves with it, for it is from a blessed tree.'
benefits: Olive oil is a healthy fat rich in antioxidants and monounsaturated fats. It reduces inflammation, supports heart health, and protects against chronic disease.

name: Couscous
reference: A staple in North African Islamic cultures, often served during special occasions and family meals.
benefits: Couscous is a light grain made from semolina. It is low in fat, a source of plant-based protein, and provides selenium, which helps boost the immune system.
